title: Quince Brandy Recipe
full_text:
Quince Brandy Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
5 mins
Infusing Time
1,008 hrs
Total
1,008 hrs 5 mins
Makes
25 ounces
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
3 to 4
fresh
quince
at peak of ripeness
1
bottle
cognac
3 to 4
whole
cloves
(optional)
1
cinnamon stick
(optional)
Directions
Wash and dry quince and either grate or finely chop. Fill 2 quart-size canning jars approximately 3/4 full of quince, add spices, and top with cognac. Seal and keep in a cool, dark place until well matured, a minimum of 6 weeks, or up to 1 year (or more?). Strain before using, passing the liquid through a fine mesh strainer and then a coffee filter to remove small particles. Enjoy.
Special Equipment
2 quart-size canning jars,
fine-mesh strainer
